Host Guidelines
Host Active
As a host, you are responsible for providing a safe and welcoming environment for travelers. This includes ensuring your property meets safety standards, clearly communicating expectations, and being available to address concerns. We recommend creating a detailed profile with photos and specific information about your property and the cultural experience you offer.
Traveler Guidelines
Traveler Active
As a traveler, you are expected to respect your host's home and culture. This includes following house rules, completing agreed-upon tasks, and being open to cultural exchange. We recommend reading host profiles carefully, asking questions before booking, and maintaining clear communication throughout your stay.
Cultural Exchange Tips
General Active
Cultural exchange is at the heart of the HomeStay experience. We encourage both hosts and travelers to share their traditions, customs, and perspectives. This can include cooking traditional meals together, sharing stories, teaching language skills, and participating in local activities. Remember to approach differences with curiosity and respect.
Payment and Fees
Payment Active
HomeStay operates on a work-exchange model where travelers provide help in exchange for accommodation. There are no direct payments between hosts and travelers. However, we charge platform fees for premium features and services. These fees help us maintain the platform, verify users, and provide support services.
Safety Guidelines
Safety Active
Your safety is our top priority. We recommend verifying your identity, reading reviews from previous experiences, and communicating through our platform until you feel comfortable. If you encounter any issues during your stay, contact our support team immediately. We have emergency contact information available 24/7.
Creating an Attractive Listing
Host Active
A well-crafted listing can attract the right travelers for your homestay. Include high-quality photos of your property and the surrounding area, clearly describe the work required, and highlight the cultural experience you offer. Be specific about your expectations, house rules, and what travelers can expect during their stay.
